title.value: UNFAIR GEOMETRIES: EXACTLY SOLVABLE DATA MODEL WITH FAIRNESS IMPLICATIONS
title.justification: This is the official title mentioned at the top of the paper.
title.quote: U NFAIR GEOMETRIES : EXACTLY SOLVABLE DATA MODEL WITH FAIRNESS IMPLICATIONS

extractions.description: The paper introduces a high-dimensional model of data imbalance (Teacher-Mixture model) to theoretically investigate bias inheritance in Machine Learning (ML) systems. It characterizes the sources of bias and studies the effectiveness of bias mitigation strategies.

type.justification: The paper primarily presents theoretical analyses and derivations to understand bias mechanisms and mitigation in ML systems.
type.quote: In the present work, we aim at clarifying the role played by data geometry in the emergence of ML bias. We introduce an exactly solvable high-dimensional model of data imbalance, where parametric control over the many bias-inducing factors allows for an extensive exploration of the bias inheritance mechanism.

name.justification: The paper's primary focus is on understanding and mitigating bias in machine learning models.
name.quote: In the present work, we aim at clarifying the role played by data geometry in the emergence of ML bias.

name.justification: The paper discusses fairness criteria and bias mitigation strategies, falling under algorithmic fairness.
name.quote: A central question in the field is on the proper mathematical definition of bias: the plethora of alternative fairness criteria includes measures of group fairness, e.g. statistical parity, disparate impact, equality of opportunity, calibration within groups, disparate mistreatment, as well as measures of individual fairness.

name.justification: The paper involves theoretical modeling and statistical physics to analyze fairness in ML.
name.quote: We derive, through a statistical physics approach, an analytical characterisation of the typical performance of solutions of the T-M problem in the high-dimensional limit.

name.justification: The paper explores bias mitigation strategies like loss reweighing and coupled learning models.
name.quote: We analytically characterise its effectiveness, finding that with this method, in the T-M, the competition between accuracy and different fairness metrics becomes negligible.

name.justification: The main model discussed in the paper for analyzing data imbalance and bias in ML.
name.quote: We devise a novel synthetic model of data, the Teacher-Mixture (T-M), to obtain a theoretical analysis of the bias-induction mechanism.

is_contributed.justification: The paper introduces the Teacher-Mixture (T-M) model as a novel contribution.
is_contributed.quote: We devise a novel synthetic model of data, the Teacher-Mixture (T-M), to obtain a theoretical analysis of the bias-induction mechanism.

is_executed.justification: The model is executed and analyzed both analytically and via numerical simulations.
is_executed.quote: The obtained learning curves are found to be in perfect agreement with numerical simulations in the same synthetic settings.

is_compared.justification: The primary focus is on analyzing the T-M model itself, not on comparing it to other models.
is_compared.quote: Through the tools of statistical physics, we analytically characterise the typical properties of learning models trained in this synthetic framework.

referenced_paper_title.justification: There is no specific referenced paper for the T-M model as it is a novel contribution.

name.justification: The TS model is referred to in the context of its relationship to the T-M model.
name.quote: The Teacher-Mixture model, sketched in Fig. 1, combines aspects of two common modelling frameworks for supervised learning, namely the Gaussian-Mixture (GM) and the Teacher-Student (TS) setups.

is_contributed.justification: The TS model is not a contribution of this paper; it's used for context.
